docs.lead_paragraph: BEN'S skate blade rests on my thigh. It is five minutes before practice starts, and I am lacing quickly. In the corner of my eye I spot a woman watching me and smiling at Ben. ''How old is he?'' she asks me.
docs.abstract: Andrea Kott essay, in light of aggressive nature of ice hockey, relishes fact that sport, for now, is just an exhilarating game for her five-year-old son; drawing (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: They have lived long enough for their days to be easy, yet on any given day Angelo Furio, 73, and David Heller, 80, are racing around Brooklyn in an old station wagon, making house calls as highly sought-after handymen. Getting a date with them can take weeks. Still, their clients speak their names with awe and adoration, in part because Mr. Furio and Mr. Heller work for no charge, and only for other old-timers whose bodies have become too frail to let them to do much around the house. So when a light bulb needs changing, a kitchen tile comes loose or the sewing machine acts up, Mr. Furio and Mr. Heller grab their tools and go.
docs.abstract: Article discusses work of Elderplan, social health maintenance organization in which elderly members help each other in varying ways; examples cited; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: A barrage of damaging cyberattacks is shaking up the security industry, with some businesses and organizations no longer assuming they can keep hackers at bay, and instead turning to waging a guerrilla war from within their networks.

docs.lead_paragraph: China’s future may be determined as much by its spiritual struggle as by its new capitalist ethos.
docs.abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column praises Evan Osmos's National Book award-winning Age of Ambition, which examines how capitalist reforms in China raised ambition levels of an entire society, which created country's prosperity; says this ambitious drive left many Chinese feeling that there is spiritual void at core of their society, and that it seems the nation's future will be determined as much by how Chinese fill that void as by political reform or capitalist innovation.
docs.snippet: China’s future may be determined as much by its spiritual struggle as by its new capitalist ethos....

keywords.value: Age of Ambition: Chasing Fortune, Truth, and Faith in the New China (Book)
